intro: Antidaphne fendleri, commonly known as the Mexican snowbell, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Aristolochiaceae and is characterized by its striking white, bell-shaped flowers. The plant has smooth, aromatic leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
